definitions.definition: fasten or fix in place with tacks.
examples: he used the tool to tack down sheets of fiberboard
synonyms: affix "a photo tacked to the wall"

definitions.definition: fasten (pieces of cloth) together temporarily with long stitches.
examples: stitch, baste, sew, bind the dress was roughly tacked together

definitions.definition: add or append something to something already existing.
examples: long-term savings plans with some life insurance tacked on
synonyms: stick (on) "poems tacked on at the end of the book"

definitions.definition: change course by turning a boat's head into and through the wind.
examples: zigzag, change direction, change course, swerve, veer; Morego about, come about, beat "the yachts tacked back and forth"Morego about, come about, beat the yachts tacked back and forth

definitions.definition: make a series of changes of course while sailing.
examples: she spent the entire night tacking back and forth
synonyms: beat "the yachts tacked back and forth"
